byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy reported from Düsseldorf, and Dan Bilefsky and Nicola Clark from Paris. Reporting was contributed by Alison Smale from Berlin; Jack Ewing from Montabaur, Germany; Raphael Minder from Barcelona, Spain; and Alissa J. Rubin and Maïa de la Baume from Seynes-les-Alpes, France.
byline.original: By MELISSA EDDY, DAN BILEFSKY and NICOLA CLARK

abstract: German authorities say Germanwings pilot Andreas Lubitz had mental illness but kept diagnosis hidden from his employer; documents found in Lubitz's home support this assertion, but there are still uncertainties regarding nature and severity of his psychiatric condition.
lead_paragraph: Among the items found at Andreas Lubitz’s home was one doctor’s note excusing him from work the day of the crash and another that had been torn up.

headline.main: Co-Pilot in Germanwings Crash Hid Mental Illness From Employer, Authorities Say
headline.print_headline: Pilot Concealed Mental Illness, Authorities Say
